author: Yuthika Bhargava
text:
Though some countries have advised their citizens to exercise caution while travelling to India, key source markets such as U.S., Germany, Canada, France, Australia and Russia have not struck India off the list of safe destinations, Parliament was informed on Monday.

In a written reply to the Lok Sabha, Tourism Minister Mahesh Sharma said there was a continuous increase in foreign tourist arrivals (FTAs) in India. The number of FTAs increased from 63,09,222 in 2011 to 80,27,133 in 2015.

Mr. Sharma said 384 cases were registered regarding crimes against foreign tourists in 2014 with Delhi reporting the highest number of such incidents at 135. It was followed by Goa with (66), U.P. (64), Rajasthan (31) and Maharashtra (25).
title: For major nations, India still safe for travel: govt
